text: Helsington is a civil parish in the South Lakeland district of the English county of Cumbria. It includes the village of Brigsteer and Sizergh Castle and Garden, a property owned by the National Trust. The parish has a population of 288, increasing to 308 at the 2011 Census. Significant Roman artefacts have been discovered in the north of the parish close to the ruined fort at Watercrook, Alavana. ==See also== *Listed buildings in Helsington ==References== ===External links=== * Helsington Parish Council Category:Civil parishes in Cumbria
title: Helsington
